intro: Miconia ibaguensis, commonly known as the Ibaguense miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Miconia ibaguensis is also known for its ability to form dense thickets, which can impact local ecosystems.
